Class DataAccessor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--DataAccessor
Direct Known Subclasses:
MusicDataAccessor, VideoDataAccessor
public abstract class DataAccessor
extends Object

This abstract class defines a trivial recordings database. Methods are available to get a list of the music categories and a list of recordings.

Subclasses must implement the methods to load and save the data. This design allows subclasses to implement a simple solution of reading/writing to a flat text file or an advanced solution of reading/writing information to a RDBMS or Socket.

Author:
App Development Team

Field Detail

dataTable

protected HashMap dataTable
A HashMap/hashtable of the recordings. The key is the "category". The data stored for each key is an ArrayList which is the collection of recordings.

recentRecordingList

protected ArrayList recentRecordingList
This hold a list of the recent recordings that have been added using the addRecording() method.
Constructor Detail

DataAccessor

public DataAccessor()
Default constructor. Initializes the dataTable and recentRecordList
Method Detail

getCategories

public ArrayList getCategories()
Returns a sorted list of the categories for the recordings.

getRecordings

public ArrayList getRecordings(String category)
Returns a sorted list of recordings that match a given category
Parameters:
category - the category for requested recordings.

addRecording

public void addRecording(Recording theRecording)
Adds a new recording to the data table in memory.

Note: This method does not save the data to persistent storage (ie disk file).

Parameters:
theRecording - the recording to add
See Also:
